sen.j: 斯波 義郷（しば よしさと、応永17年（1410年） - 永享8年9月30日 (旧暦)（1436年11月8日））は室町時代中期の守護大名。
sen.e: Yoshisato SHIBA (1410 - November 8, 1436) was a Shugo Daimyo (military governor) in the mid-Muromachi period.
Yoshisato SHIBA (1410 - November 8, 1436) was a Shugo Daimyo (military governor) in the mid-Muromachi period.
Yoshisato SHIBA (1410 - November 17, 1436) was a Shugo Daimyo (military governor) in the mid-Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。

sen.e: He was a second son of Yoshishige SHIBA.
He was the second son of Yoshishige SHIBA.
He was the second son of Yoshishige SHIBA.
His mother was a daughter of Norimitsu KAI.
His mother was a daughter of Norimitsu KAI.
His mother was a daughter of Norimitsu KAI.

sen.j: 斯波義淳は異母兄、同母弟に斯波持有。
sen.e: Yoshiatsu SHIBA was his half elder brother with the same father and Mochiari SHIBA was his half younger brother with the same mother.
Yoshiatsu SHIBA was his half elder brother with the same father and Mochiari SHIBA was his half younger brother with the same mother.
Yoshiatsu SHIBA was his half elder brother with the same father and Mochiari SHIBA was his half younger brother with the same mother.

sen.j: 官位履歴は、従五位下から従四位下。
sen.e: His initial official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the final one was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
His initial official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the final one was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
His initial official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the final one was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 治部大輔そして左衛門佐。
sen.e: He served as Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration) and later as Saemon no suke (Assistant Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
He served as Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration) and later as Saemon no suke (Assistant Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
He served as Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration) and later as Saemon no suke (Assistant Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).

sen.j: 初め僧籍にあり、瑞鳳と名乗り相国寺の鄂隠和尚の弟子であった。
sen.e: Initially he was a monk named Zuiho and was a disciple of Gakuin osho (monk) of Shokoku-ji Temple.
Initially he was a monk named Zuiho and was a disciple of Gakuin osho (monk) of Shokoku-ji Temple.
Initially he was a monk named Zuiho and was a disciple of Gakuin osho (monk) of Shokoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 永享5年（1433年）11月、兄義淳が重病となると、足利義教の命により還俗、斯波氏の家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: When his elder brother Yoshiatsu fell seriously ill in Nevember, 1433, he returned to a secular life and succeeded the headship of the Shiba clan at the behest of Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
When his elder brother Yoshiatsu fell seriously ill in Nevember, 1433, he returned to secular life and succeeded the headship of the Shiba clan at the behest of Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
When his elder brother Yoshiatsu fell seriously ill in December, 1433, he returned to secular life and succeeded the headship of the Shiba clan at the behest of Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: Novemberスペル訂正しました。グレゴリオ歴に変換

sen.j: 永享6年（1434年）2月に室町幕府に出仕。
sen.e: In February, 1434, he started to serve as the officer of Muromachi bakufu.
In February, 1434, he started to serve as an officer of Muromachi bakufu.
In March, 1434, he started to serve as an officer of Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 越前国・尾張国・遠江国の守護職を継承する。
sen.e: He succeeded the post of shugo of Echizen no kuni (Echizen Province), Owari no kuni (Owari Province) and Totomi no kuni (Totomi Province).
He succeeded the post of shugo of Echizen no kuni (Echizen Province), Owari no kuni (Owari Province) and Totomi no kuni (Totomi Province).
He succeeded the post of shugo of Echizen no kuni (Echizen Province), Owari no kuni (Owari Province) and Totomi no kuni (Totomi Province).

sen.j: しかし、家督を継いでわずか3年後の永享8年（1436年）9月29日、三条中納言宅訪問の帰路、陸橋から馬もろとも転落し、翌30日に死去した。
sen.e: However, on September 29, 1436, only three years after succeeding the reigns of the clan, he fell from an overpass together with his horse on the way back from the residence of Sanjo Chunagon (Middle Counselor) and died on the following day, the 30th.

However, on September 29, 1436, only three years after succeeding the reigns of the clan, he fell from an overpass together with his horse on the way back from the residence of Sanjo Chunagon (Middle Counselor) and died on the following day, the 30th.

However, on November 16, 1436, only three years after succeeding the reigns of the clan, he fell from an overpass together with his horse on the way back from the residence of Sanjo Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) and died on the following day, the 17th.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。中納言の説明を(vice-councilor of state)に訂正しました。

sen.e: His age at death was 27.
His age at death was 27.
His age at death was 27.

sen.j: 法名は宝泉院殿道慶祥岩。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Hosen-inden Dokei Shogan.
His posthumous name was Hosen-inden Dokei Shogan.
His posthumous name was Hosen-inden Dokei Shogan.

sen.j: 家督は子の斯波義健がわずか2歳で継いだ。
sen.e: Yoshitake SHIBA, his son, succeeded the headship of the clan only at the age of 2.
Yoshitake SHIBA, his son, succeeded the headship of the clan at the age of 2.
Yoshitake SHIBA, his son, succeeded the headship of the clan at the age of 2.
